College Sport Roundup

127 Points In Two Away Matches

Two convincing victories have left the women's rugby team demanding tougher opposition.

James unbeaten

Women's six-a-side tournament results:

Brawl at Bootham

York City secured their sixth draw in seven league games in a lively encounter at Bootham Crescent.

Basketball Club Victorious

The Edge

Always remember, never mix sport & singing.

York Hosts Snooker Championships

Imran Shaikh reports on Matthew Stevens' long awaited UK championship title.

York Students lead England to victory

You Lose Some

Amber Martin reports on the fortunes of the women's basketball first team

Piste Off?

Kelvin Rollo, on travelling with Skiclub.

You Win Some

Tom Round reports on the fortunes of the men's basketball first team

James' Lead Wavers

AU Vice President Stuart Leslie on this years inter-College tournament

Women Squander Lead

The first game of the new season saw York's women surrender a two goal lead against an inferior St. John's side.

Tigers Take Down Geordies

A strong win over Northumbria University put the collaborative York/York St John's team, the 'York Tigers' ahead of their nearest rivals, on the Northeast rugby league table, with two wins in as many games.

No-Score Bore Draw

Despite two red cards , York City's trip to Scunthorpe was a dull affair. Jamie Willard reports.

City Under Siege

With York City potentially facing a pair of lawsuits from former staff members James Redgrave talks exclusively to their solicitor, George Coyle.

York Student Top of Lacrosse

After steering York Lacrosse to the Northern BUSA Premier Division, captain Bethany Gray was called up to the England squad.

York Overtake the Blues

It wasn't just league tables that saw York trounce the Oxbridge darlings, but York Karting stole the Varsity trophy from under their nose. James Izzard reports on why their were tears before bedtime

No Balls and Fine Legs

"We are a friendly bunch", says captain Lucy Horitz of the women's cricket team...

Aerobic Adventures

Aerobics queen Jo Staples sets out the clubs agenda

The AU edge

Did anyone hear the joke about new sports facilities?

A Paddle In The Alps

Claire Albrighton reports on Canoe Polo's whitewater tour of the French Alps

James College - Top of the Sport Leagues

A 37 point lead gave James the shiny trophy of College Sport. Dan Phillips asks the Sports Reps, as they going to repeat it this year?

Flamboyant Alcuin fall to Goodricke

While skill may have been sporadic in the college volleyball, it was not without its highlights.

Halifax Lose Lead

College Basketball

Langwith Lead Futsal

Langwith's strong performance sees them unchallenged in the week 6 Futsal Tournament

Knights tame the Lions

Dan Phillips watches York City Knights trounce Swinton Lions 40 - 2

Dan Phillips talks to new City manager Chirs Brass as he jets off to Portugal

Brass is best

City's first lady, Director Sophie McGill tells Dan Phillips about their choice
